Reviews.Title: “As Expected, Good Place”
Reviews.Author: shaunbsc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3/2012, booked thru priceline ($65 memphis east). Check in was very fast and smooth, which was appreciated. Room was very large and comfortable with a king bed. Big bathroom, very spacious. Place was clean, AC worked just fine as well. There is no fridge in the room, which was a surprise. Breakfast was good, but I had a problem with payment. They insisted on charging the meal to my room, but for my business expense purposed I need to pay for it on a company card. Their credit card system was not working so they charged it to my room, which I was not happy about. But, breakfast was good. A big turnoff is a large train that is located across the street. It came barreling through at 5am and was very loud and shook the entire room, waking me up. I've stayed at the Hyatt directly next door and did not have this issue so I probably won't stay here again. But that being said, this is a nice place and the value was good.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but that's it”
Reviews.Author: jhassinger
Reviews.Content: Not your best Courtyard. Dated. Walls are paper thin. Toilets slow and stop up easily. Professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: lucyimhome
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at great Priceline bid. Train side was not a problem. (Whistles don't blow this stretch of bridge.) Free morning coffee and paper. Alternate entrances convenient. Location was perfect next to hospital and close to but not on busy Poplar. For the retail price, the room should have a mirror (preferably full length) outside the bathroom. And a mini-fridge in the empty cabinet plus a microwave. All we needed was a clean comfy bed/bath to spend the night(s). Would stay here again at the right bid.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but...”
Reviews.Author: barinr
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many Courtyards. The rooms are nice and the staff very friendly, but it has not been upgraded to the new lobby. The lobby looks a bit tired. Ask for the side away from the train tracks.

Reviews.Title: “smokers mess up hotel”
Reviews.Author: lotsotripsneedsleep
Reviews.Content: Great room, wonderful staff, good breakfast, but someone smoked in a neighboring room and ruined it. The staff handled my concerns as best they could, but they do need to find a way to better enforce their rules. I would like to see some posting from the hotel on how many guests complain of smoke, how many guests are fined for smoking, and what they do to clean up smokey rooms

Reviews.Title: “Graceland stopover”
Reviews.Author: charlesodonnell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the way to Graceland. Many hotels near Graceland are overpriced. This one is not. It is about 20 minutes away and next door to a 4 star restaurant. Easy to find and plenty of rooms and parking. The hotel itself was very clean, very quiet (despite being next to the freeway), and luxorious compared to other hotels that are priced beloww 100.00 a night. Staff service was excellent as well. I would gladly stay here again. Use your AARP or AAA card for the best rate and enjoy a nice dinner and a great nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: IBLibrarian
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in a Courtyard Marriott property and it was very pleasant. The East/Park Avenue Courtyard is an older facility, but very clean, and our room was absolutely spotless. Although very small and decorated more in a minimalist style, our room was comfortable and the bed/pillows were first rate. Not much in the way of toiletries, no lotion included, and the coffee holder sported those one cup packages we really don't care for, but it was Royal Cup and tasty. The tub had a good safety bar--all hotels should--and that was appreciated. Our room rate included the breakfast buffet from the little restaurant in the lobby (scrambled eggs/cooked to order omelets, bacon, sausage, potatoes, biscuits/gravy, fruit, pastries, oatmeal) and it was plentiful and good. Hostesses showed Marriott hospitality and served our coffee, juice in good mugs and glasses rather than the usual styrofoam. It was a pleasant change from the substandard fare most chains call a "free" breakfast. I would suggest salt/pepper shakers be wiped and refilled...ours were not, but the good breakfast was worth that little inconvenience. The breakfast area was light-filled, gas logs were lit and it was really a nice way to begin the day. Staff was friendly for the most part. We enjoyed this part of Memphis and there was a Target across the way for a quick dash to pick up needed items. Nice. The newer Courtyards may be a little more plush, but we enjoyed a quiet, stress-free stay and will likely come again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: NeRock04
Reviews.Content: My room included a flat screen, king bed, small refrigerator, free wireless internet and balcony. I thought it was very clean and comfortable. I received a low price by bidding on the room so it was a great deal; still I would consider paying a higher price since it was nice and convenient. I was able to get an early check-in and they even accommodated my request for a room off of the ground floor. Highway entrance/exits are nearby as well as shops and restaurants. Overall, it was a great experience and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: denny060
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms, excellent polite and professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Hortman55
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel and it was pleasant experience. The staff was courteous and quickly checked us in. Beds were comfortable. Price was basically in line of what all other hotels were charging. We try to either stay in a Marriott or Hitlon brand hotel. This hotel was a nice Marriott property.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Room -- Bring your own ethernet cable”
Reviews.Author: tonystan
Reviews.Content: I really liked the hotel, I do have a couple of issues with it which prevented me from giving it 4 stars, but the issues may be enough to cause some folks to look elsewhere. The Good: Extremely comfortable bed, mattress had that "foamy" feel of the beds in Marriott hotels, you get these often in Courtyard properties, but not always (see Courtyard Southaven, MS). Flat screen TV with decent channel lineup and HD channels. Ample parking and plenty of entrances all around the building (all requiring key-card access except the lobby). Nice water temperature and pressure in the shower. Outdoor pool with ample sunlight for those wanting to tan (NOTE: it appeared the pool was closed during my stay) as well as an indoor whirlpool adjacent to the pool area. Small workout room with dumbbells, a couple of treadmills and eliptical machines, each with their own monitor. The Bad: No wifi in the room. Free in-room internet was available, but it was wired and I did not notice an ethernet cable in the room. I did have an issue with noise from another room, I don't know if it was because it was coming from the adjoining room (there was an adjoining door in my room), but I could hear the folks next door talking in the morning. It was loud enough to wake me, but as it wasn't too early in the morning, it didn't bother me, but could definitely be an issue. Location: Right off of 240 on the desirable east side of Memphis, many restaurants and shopping areas nearby.

Reviews.Title: “If you need Internet access, pick another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zaphod247
Reviews.Content: Ethernet only in your room, so don't think of working in bed. Even with an Ethernet connection, bandwidth speed tests topping out at 47K. Useless for even receiving "large" email attachments (like a photo of your kid). Apple and Skype video conferencing both give up on the slow connection. Netflix made a sound that I swear was a chuckle before it told me my connection was insufficient. My company VPN keeps booting me off for lack of connection. Front desk says IBAHN offers "upgrade" for $3 - $5 PER HOUR! For the rates this hotel is charging, calling this "free Internet" should be false advertising!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: RaDeN
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good area with many dining choices nearby. The room was a bit small but clean and comfortable. I only heard the train once and it did not interrupt my sleep. Internet is free but not very fast. TV had HD channels which is nice. Overall, a good hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good but Needs Attention to Details”
Reviews.Author: bobsflint
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel. It is a good value and well located. The room was comfortable and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. But, I had to change rooms as the AC was not working. In the second room the toilet would not flush, some electrical outlets did not work, coffee was not replaced on the second morning, nor was the kleenex replaced. It does have wireless internet (wired) but that does not work on most modern devices. Breakfast was just OK. Still, it was a good value overall.

Reviews.Title: “The train across the way woke us all night”
Reviews.Author: TMcE10
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean, the breakfast was not great most stuff was cold and the service was lacking. the worst was that we got a room on the side of the hotel that had the train line across the way from it so at 4:30 am and again around 5:30am the train seemed to stop on the line outside for about a half hour it sounded like a very loud a/c unit maybe there was a problem on the line and we just were unlucky but it ruined our nights sleep

Reviews.Title: “Good and clean”
Reviews.Author: getachkaraoke
Reviews.Content: The room was clean. However basic amenities like lotion had to be requested. Also, there were only two mirrors in the room and they were both in the same area. By the sink and closet. They offer a hot buffet breakfast but charged $10! So we went to the nearby La Quinta as we had friends staying there and enjoyed their free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good room for the price”
Reviews.Author: MiMomOf2
Reviews.Content: We honestly didn't stay in the room much, but it was a large open room even with a king bed, sofa and large work space. The pool area was lovely and we had a room that opened right out by it. However the sauna/hot tub was out of order during our visit which seems to be an ongoing thing for us :( My husband checked in so I'm not sure about service but he was in and out quite quickly. It is next to a hospital so I did hear some ambulances and we did see the train go buy twice but neither of them were loud enough to wake us. Bed was very comfortable. It was a good deal for only $50 thru priceline. Would have been nice if they'd had some kind of contential breakfast though.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: crxcte
Reviews.Content: Over it was a good hotel. Clean rooms and surroundings. We stayed 3 nights, free internet, good location, near restaurants, fairly quiet. I would return in the future. Pool and lobby was nice. I've stayed in many hotels and can say this hotel has management that cares about the service they provide.

Reviews.Title: “RUN FAR AWAY”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeGirlMimi
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely the worst Courtyard I've ever stayed at. I booked through Priceline and got a good rate, but that's the best thing about it. We stayed for two nights, on August 9th and 11th. (Spent the 10th in Arkansas.) Within two hours of checking in, we were bitten by ANTS in the BED! The front desk clerk came and saw the bugs but unfortunately couldn't give us another room since they were sold out. She was very nice and promised me that she'd report it and that I'd be compensated appropriately by the manager. When I came back on the 11th, I asked for to be put into another section of the hotel, which I was. I asked for an upgrade since I'd been promised to be taken care of upon my return. I was told that they were unable to do that because I'd paid through priceline *which isn't true. Priceline told me it was entirely up to the hotel. The next morning, I found a different type of bug. a COCKROACH. I asked the manager to come and see what I'd killed and she refused. I did have a housekeeper come and see it and this time I took a picture. The GM refused to take care of me in any way, shape or form. I was told that they'd be turning it into their insurance company and I'd be hearing from them. I still haven't heard a thing and have gotten no help whatsoever. RUN AS FAR AWAY AS YOU CAN FROM THIS DUMP!!!

Reviews.Title: “Apparently it was renovated in a month...”
Reviews.Author: lnlharper
Reviews.Content: ...or (some of) my fellow reviewers are unbelievably hard to please. I actually checked out the reviews before I booked this hotel for a rewards stay with my son and his best friend. We were on a road trip from Houston to Sandusky, OH and this was mid way. Train-What train? I am a light sleeper and, while I heard the train's whistle, it was not overly loud. Because it was a Marriott reward, I expected to be placed either next to the elevator, the ice machine or both. I was pleasantly surprised to find myself on the 2nd floor, with a balcony overlooking the pool. The boys enjoyed the pool, which was quite clean, quiet and not overchlorinated as you find in many hotels. The beds were clean and really comfy, much nicer than the high end waterpark/hotel we were traveling to. We did not partake of the breakfast due to personal reasons. I always feel weird eating breakfast in, what amounts to, the hotel lobby. The front desk staff were pleasant and we had a nice chat while checking in. In short, it is a conviently located, clean hotel with a nice staff for the average person. Now, if you're the princess-constantly feeling for that nonexistant pea...well then might I suggest The Peabody. Although I've stayed there as well and the beds are awfully lumpy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Terrific Room”
Reviews.Author: meyerinc
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful, very accommodating. We arrived early for our check-in, and the front desk and the housekeeping staff saw to it that we were able to get into our room. We were more than willing to come back later, but they insisted on getting it ready right away. We were very pleased with our room (king): very spacious and well-appointed. We had a sofa area, and the bed was tucked around a corner and sat parallel to the entry walkway instead of the usual perpendicular placement that 99.9% of hotel rooms use, which gave the space an entirely different, refreshing feel. It didn't scream: "You're in a hotel room" (if that makes any sense). The only problem we had had very little to do with the hotel itself. We were in a room facing the courtyard/pool (as others here have suggested to tone down the sound from the railroad). There was a group of adults hanging out in the courtyard until after 1:00 am, which in and of itself was fine. It was a Saturday night; we didn't have to get up at the crack of dawn. Had they been simply chatting and having a laugh or two, it would have been okay; but unfortunately, this one woman kept shrieking and screaming every few minutes. Should we have complained to the front desk? I suppose. So we have only ourselves to blame for enduring having to listen to this drunken stumble bum. I guess my mentioning it here is just to say that the train noise on the other side of the building might have been preferable to having to listen to the Queen of the Harpies. We loved the hotel over all and will definitely stay there again if we return to Memphis. Getting downtown was a short drive, yet you're not paying the higher prices and you're not having to pay for overnight parking (which you'd have to do downtown). Not only did we have a lower rate staying in the burbs, but we also booked under a special deal they were offering in which we received a $20 gas card. Awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: GenevaLand
Reviews.Content: I don't understand why this place got some really good reviews on Trip Advisor. This place needs a serious renovation. It is run down and dirty. I found a live bug in my bed, stepped on a nail that was protruding from the carpet, and saw a slug on the wall in the stairwell. Need I say more? I have to admit the staff there was really nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: pekinIL
Reviews.Content: We booked this room for next to nothing on priceline, but it was definately a nice place to stay. Rooms all have Balconies, or patios. Nice hottub room. Excellent houskeeping staff.

Reviews.Title: “Strange Room Layout”
Reviews.Author: budicejoe
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place to stay. I found it through priceline.com "name your own price." I don't think its worthy of $92/nite on hotels.com/expedia. The bed was facing the window and the TV was on the other side. While laying in bed you had to be on your side to watch TV. (kinda strange). Internet was free and worked ok with my laptop. The wireless keyboard for the internet tv did not work however. (Thank god I had my laptop)

Reviews.Title: “Not so great, not so bad”
Reviews.Author: BenjaB
Reviews.Content: I had just stayed at a Courtyard in Chattanooga and that stay was excellent, so I expected the same here in Memphis just one night later. Alas, it was not to be. The front desk staff person was not so helpful, the room was so-so (with a poor internet connection, although it was free) and the breakfast was below expectations -- long wait, slow service, nobody offered to make the much-touted eggs, and the seating area seemed cramped. The only thing that was positive was that the rate was $50 cheaper than the stay in Chattanooga.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Environment”
Reviews.Author: HollisCross621
Reviews.Content: I was here on a business trip and appreciated the clean appearance, the well-cared-for outside pool, the indoor large whirlpool and the buffet breakfast. My room was quiet and the internet connection was good. I would have liked a flat screen TV! I also liked the business center with it's 2 computers and each had their own printer. The room was spacious even with the king bed. There are plenty of restaurants nearby also. I highly recommend the Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: california_dreaming1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business and was qutie comfortable. The staff was very helpful, especially one individual whose name escapes me now. I have to write these reviews in a more timely fashion. The noise from the trains was minimal and not a factor in my stay. The whirlpool malfunctioned and was down during my stay but that happens at my gym back home too. The accomodations were clean and comfortable. The computers in the lobby functioned well, as did the LAN connection and WiFi converter in the room. I loved the location and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for price”
Reviews.Author: The_Webs
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, with a real down comforter. The pool was a big hit with the kids, and the hot tub was a nice surprise for the adults. The exercise room was adequate, and free 24 hour coffee, tea and hot cocoa in the lobby. Breakfast was a bit expensive, and although we were facing the courtyard we still heard the trains all night.

Reviews.Title: “a little noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent the night (July 1, 2006) at this Courtyard in Memphis. Rooms were pretty clean, buffet breakfast was great. Service was average. Stayed in room 133. This room is across the street from the train track. It seemed like a train came by every hour. I remember counting at least 5 or 6 throughout the night. Each time a train passed It felt, and sounded, as if it was coming through our room. Otherwise, the stay was good. Just didn't get enough sleep. I stayed here 3 or 4 years earlier but do not remember the trains..I believe I was on the other side of the building. Ask for a room away from the train track..otherwise....you will not get much sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Courtyard, but great staff elevate to above average”
Reviews.Author: amh3855
Reviews.Content: A very typical Courtyard by Marriott - no difference in the rooms, breakfast, etc. than any others that I have stayed in. What elevates this hotel to "above average" is that the staff is very pleasant and helpful. On my most recent stay, I had had a very long, tiring day and walked into a lobby full of a group of high school soccer teams who were checking in as well. I thought I would be waiting at least 30 minutes, but the staff managed to get me checked in under 5 minutes and with smiles on their faces too. Every time I have stayed here, the employees have been very pleasant and efficient but they certainly exceeded all expectations in this case. The other plus is free high speed internet access. A very good hotel for business travelers.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard by Marriott Memphis East/Park Avenue
HotelInfo.Address: 6015 Park Avenue, Memphis, TN 38119
